properties.description:
Summary of actions

Retrieves table metadata (DESCU, COMPANY) from the Autoline DMS via a linked server to get the right tablename independent of usages of long or short table names in autoline.

Looks up all non-system columns from the destination Azure SQL table.

Iterates through each Autoline table (DESCU) to sync so when a table is present n multiple locations they will all be fetched.

Dynamically builds a SELECT query using resolved columns and filters.

Copies source data into a staging table in Azure SQL.

If the destination table has a primary key, deletes matching records using a JOIN.

If no primary key, deletes by _set, _company, and optional destinationfilters.

Inserts fresh data from the temp table into the destination with metadata.

Drops the temp table after successful sync.

activities.name: LookupTableName
activities.description: Builds a dynamic SQL query to retrieve DESCU and COMPANY from the Autoline catalogue. If the autolineModule is 'GB', 'SU', it applies a simple filename filter. Otherwise, it includes additional filters on module, company, user, and priority to enforce data access rules.

dependsOn.activity: Report failure if no tables found in catalogue

preCopyScript.value:
IF OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[_temp_@{item().DESCU}_@{pipeline().parameters.linkedServer}]', N'U') IS NOT NULL
BEGIN
    DROP TABLE [dbo].[_temp_@{item().DESCU}_@{pipeline().parameters.linkedServer}];
END

text.value:
-- ========================================
-- Dynamic merge-like operation for ADF
-- Deletes and reinserts data from a temp source table into a target table
-- Behavior depends on whether the destination table has a primary key
-- ========================================

-- Declare input variables using ADF pipeline expressions
DECLARE @TargetTable SYSNAME = '@{pipeline().parameters.targetTable}'; -- Destination table name
DECLARE @TempTable SYSNAME = 'dbo._temp_@{item().DESCU}_@{pipeline().parameters.linkedServer}'; -- Staging temp table
DECLARE @LinkedServer NVARCHAR(100) = '@{pipeline().parameters.linkedServer}'; -- Source identifier
DECLARE @Company NVARCHAR(100) = '@{item().COMPANY}'; -- Company identifier
DECLARE @FinalFilterDestination NVARCHAR(MAX) = '@{variables('finalAddedFilterDestination')}'; -- Optional dynamic WHERE clause filter
DECLARE @clearBeforeLoad BIT = '@{pipeline().parameters.clearBeforeLoad}'; -- Optional dynamic WHERE clause filter

--Declare output Variables
DECLARE @write_count INT = 0;


-- Variables for internal logic
DECLARE @PKJoin NVARCHAR(MAX) = ''; -- To hold generated primary key join condition
DECLARE @HasPK BIT = 0; -- Flag to determine if destination table has a primary key

-- ========================================
-- Step 1: Check for a primary key on the destination table
-- If it exists, build a JOIN clause using all key columns
-- ========================================
IF EXISTS (
    SELECT 1
    FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLE_CONSTRAINTS tc
    WHERE tc.TABLE_NAME = @TargetTable
      AND tc.CONSTRAINT_TYPE = 'PRIMARY KEY'
) and @clearBeforeLoad = 0
BEGIN
    SET @HasPK = 1;
    
    -- Generate dynamic ON clause: A.pk1 = B.pk1 AND A.pk2 = B.pk2 ...
    SELECT @PKJoin = STRING_AGG('A.' + QUOTENAME(kcu.COLUMN_NAME) + ' = B.' + QUOTENAME(kcu.COLUMN_NAME), ' AND ')
    FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLE_CONSTRAINTS tc
    JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE kcu 
        ON tc.CONSTRAINT_NAME = kcu.CONSTRAINT_NAME
    WHERE tc.CONSTRAINT_TYPE = 'PRIMARY KEY'
      AND tc.TABLE_NAME = @TargetTable;
END

-- ========================================
-- Step 2: DELETE logic depending on PK presence
-- If PK exists: delete matching rows using JOIN
-- If no PK: delete based on _set, _company, and optional filters
-- ========================================
DECLARE @DeleteSQL NVARCHAR(MAX);

BEGIN TRY
    IF @HasPK = 1
    BEGIN
        -- DELETE using primary key match
        SET @DeleteSQL = '
        DELETE A
        FROM ' + QUOTENAME(@TargetTable) + ' A
        JOIN ' + @TempTable + ' B
          ON ' + @PKJoin + ';';
        EXEC sp_executesql @DeleteSQL;
        print @DeleteSQL;
    END
    ELSE
    BEGIN
          -- DELETE using fallback logic (_set, _company, filter)
        SET @DeleteSQL = '
        DELETE FROM ' + QUOTENAME(@TargetTable) + '
        WHERE _set = ''' + @LinkedServer + '''
          AND _company = ''' + @Company + ''' ' + @FinalFilterDestination + ';';
        EXEC sp_executesql @DeleteSQL;
        print @DeleteSQL; 
    END

    -- Capture row count before insert
    SET @write_count = @@ROWCOUNT;

-- ========================================
-- Step 3: INSERT all rows from temp table into the destination
-- Includes fixed columns (_set, _company, _LTSTUPDATE, _LTSTCHECK)
-- Plus dynamically injected column list from ADF
-- ========================================
    INSERT INTO @{pipeline().parameters.targetTable}
    SELECT
        '@{pipeline().parameters.linkedServer}' AS _set,
        '@{item().COMPANY}' AS _company,
        GETDATE() AS [_LTSTUPDATE],
        GETDATE() AS [_LTSTCHECK],
        @{variables('columnList')}
    FROM dbo._temp_@{item().DESCU}_@{pipeline().parameters.linkedServer};


-- ========================================
-- Step 4: return the number of rows for validation
-- ========================================
    -- Capture row count
    SET @write_count = @@ROWCOUNT - @write_count;

    -- Return write_count to ADF
    SELECT @write_count AS write_count;

END TRY
BEGIN CATCH
    PRINT 'Error occurred: ' + ERROR_MESSAGE();
    THROW;
END CATCH

activities.name: Report failure if number of rows not equal

text.value:
INSERT INTO [dbo].[_SyncLog]
           ([timestamp]
           ,[pipelineRunId]
           ,[pipelineName]
           ,[tableName]
           ,[linkedServer]
           ,[count]
           ,[triggerTime]
           ,[details])
     VALUES
           (getdate()
           ,'@{pipeline().RunId}'
           ,'@{pipeline().Pipeline}'
           ,'@{item().DESCU}'
           ,'@{pipeline().parameters.linkedServer}'
           ,@{activity('Replace into Data into').output.resultSets[0].rows[0].write_count}
           ,cast('@{pipeline().TriggerTime}' as datetime2)
           ,(SELECT *
                  FROM [dbo].[_SyncIndex]
                  WHERE sourceTable = '@{pipeline().parameters.sourceTable}' AND (linkedServer = '@{pipeline().parameters.linkedServer}' or linkedServer = '**')  
                  FOR JSON PATH, WITHOUT_ARRAY_WRAPPER)
)

activities.name: Lookup Columns
activities.description: Select all columnames from the destination table that do not start with '_"

sqlReaderQuery.value: SELECT COLUMN_NAME FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME = '@{pipeline().parameters.targetTable}' and left(COLUMN_NAME, 1) <> '_'

activities.name: Set Catalogue tablename
activities.description: based on the linkedserver we need to switch between long or short table names

activities.name: Set linkedServer
activities.description: clean up the incoming parameter tolower and trim

activities.name: Report failure if no tables found in catalogue
Read me
activities.description:
âœ… Summary: Full sync Autoline DMS
This pipeline performs a full synchronization of data from the Autoline DMS system into an Azure SQL database. It:

1. Identifies source tables from the Autoline catalogue, adjusting for naming conventions and access filters.

2. Looks up active target tables and their non-system columns to build dynamic SELECT statements.

3. Iterates through all matching source tables (including multiple linked servers if needed).

4. Copies data into temporary staging tables in Azure SQL.

5. Performs a conditional data merge:
      Deletes existing records by primary key (if present), or by _set, _company, and optional filters.

6. Inserts updated data from the temp table into the target table with audit metadata.

7. Validates record counts to ensure completeness.

8. Cleans up staging tables post-load.

9. Fails the pipeline if data is missing or mismatched.

This ensures accurate, filtered, and scalable data synchronization across multiple companies or environments in Autoline.
